toolSpecificData.prompt:
Research the workspace at d:\Repos\_pm\copilot to understand how the agent instructions and skills are structured, specifically looking for anything related to step-by-step guides, tutorials, walkthroughs, or guided processes.

Your task is RESEARCH ONLY ‚Äî do NOT draft a plan or make edits.

Steps:
1. List the contents of `.copilot-core/skills/agent/` to see all agent skills
2. List the contents of `.copilot-core/skills/` to see all skill types
3. Read the main instructions file at `.copilot-core/instructions/agent-skills-core.instructions.md` ‚Äî look for anything related to step-by-step, guided, or interactive workflows
4. Search for any existing skills or instructions related to "passo a passo", "step-by-step", "guided", "walkthrough", "tutorial"
5. Read the `agent-task-manage` skill (find it and read SKILL.md) since it deals with multi-step tasks
6. Read the `agent-action-review` skill
7. Check if there's any skill related to teaching, guiding, or interactive processes
8. Read the `skill-template-create` SKILL.md to understand the skill template format
9. List `.copilot-project/skills/` to see project-specific skills
10. Read `.copilot-project/context/project.md` for project context
11. Check `.copilot-project/memory/lessons-learned.md` for any related lessons

Return:
- Full list of all agent skills (with descriptions from frontmatter if readable)
- The complete content of `agent-task-manage` SKILL.md
- The complete content of `skill-template-create` SKILL.md
- The structure of all skill types
- Any existing patterns for interactive/guided workflows
- The agent-skills-core.instructions.md sections related to task management and complex tasks
- Any relevant lessons learned
- Full path to every file you read

toolSpecificData.result:
All research is complete. Here's the comprehensive report:

---

## Research Results

### 1. All Skill Types Structure

| Type | Path | Count | Purpose |
|------|------|-------|---------|
| `agent` | [.copilot-core/skills/agent/](.copilot-core/skills/agent/) | 12 | Memory, delegation, tasks, sessions, validation, sync, reflection |
| `code` | [.copilot-core/skills/code/](.copilot-core/skills/code/) | 22 | Review, .NET generation, CQRS/DDD, tests, bash/powershell |
| `editor` | [.copilot-core/skills/editor/](.copilot-core/skills/editor/) | 2 | Markdown lint, READMEs |
| `infra` | [.copilot-core/skills/infra/](.copilot-core/skills/infra/) | 12 | Docker, K8s, Redis, GCP, pipelines, JWT, messaging |
| `project` | [.copilot-core/skills/project/](.copilot-core/skills/project/) | 10 | Context, codemap, setup, branches, analysis |
| `skill` | [.copilot-core/skills/skill/](.copilot-core/skills/skill/) | 2 | Create and validate skills |

### 2. Full List of Agent Skills (with descriptions)

| # | Skill | Description | Delegable |
|---|-------|-------------|-----------|
| 1 | `agent-action-review` | Valida completude e consist√™ncia das a√ß√µes realizadas. Verifica side-effects obrigat√≥rios (codemap, mem√≥ria, contexto, contagens). Auto-triggered ap√≥s task-manage. | `full` |
| 2 | `agent-catalog-query` | Cat√°logo de skills do tipo agent ‚Äî descoberta r√°pida. | `full` |
| 3 | `agent-chat-resume` | Retoma sess√£o de chat salva anteriormente, apresentando briefing e permitindo continua√ß√£o. | `full` |
| 4 | `agent-chat-save` | Salva estado da sess√£o de chat para retomada posterior. Auto ap√≥s task-manage completar. | `full` |
| 5 | `agent-git-guard` | Controla permiss√µes de opera√ß√µes git por projeto. Toda opera√ß√£o git DEVE passar por esta skill. Default = bloqueado. | `none` |
| 6 | `agent-impact-validate` | Valida impacto em cascata de edi√ß√µes multi-arquivo. Refer√™ncias cruzadas, consist√™ncia de nomes/paths/contagens. | `full` |
| 7 | `agent-memory-query` | Consulta li√ß√µes aprendidas. Prioriza MCP search sem√¢ntico, fallback .md. | `full` |
| 8 | `agent-memory-register` | Registra novas li√ß√µes. Dual-write: .md + MCP sync. Auto quando usu√°rio corrige c√≥digo gerado. | `full` |
| 9 | `agent-memory-sync` | Sincroniza .md com MCP memory-service (Cloudflare Vectorize). Full rebuild ou incremental. | `full` |
| 10 | `agent-subagent-delegate` | Define regras para delega√ß√£o de skills a subagents via runSubagent. Classifica por viabilidade. | `full` |
| 11 | `agent-task-manage` | Gerencia tarefas complexas (4+ steps) com `manage_todo_list`. Visibilidade e tracking. | `none` |
| 12 | `agent-turn-reflect` | Reflex√£o autom√°tica per-turn. Triage r√°pido ‚Üí aprofunda se detecta algo relevante. Silencioso se nada. | `none` |

### 3. Complete Content of `agent-task-manage` SKILL.md

**File**: [.copilot-core/skills/agent/agent-task-manage/SKILL.md](.copilot-core/skills/agent/agent-task-manage/SKILL.md)

Key structure:
- **Trigger**: Tasks with 4+ distinct steps, multiple requests, multiple files, requires planning
- **Tool**: `manage_todo_list`
- **States**: `not-started` ‚Üí `in-progress` (max 1) ‚Üí `completed`
- **Workflow**: Assess complexity ‚Üí Create todo list ‚Üí Execute and update sequentially ‚Üí Adjust during execution ‚Üí Finalize with chain: `task-manage ‚Üí action-review ‚Üí chat-save`
- **No interactive/guided mode** ‚Äî purely task tracking/execution

(Full content already displayed above in the read_file output)

### 4. Complete Content of `skill-template-create` SKILL.md

**File**: [.copilot-core/skills/skill/skill-template-create/SKILL.md](.copilot-core/skills/skill/skill-template-create/SKILL.md)

Key structure:
- **Delegable**: `orchestrated` (main agent collects 6 inputs, subagent generates)
- **Workflow**: Collect info (6 questions) ‚Üí Determine location ‚Üí Create SKILL.md ‚Üí Create config.yml ‚Üí Test ‚Üí Sync MCP ‚Üí Confirm
- **Template sections**: Frontmatter, Quando Usar, Config Loading, Workflow, Padr√µes, Checklist, Config Schema
- **Has an interactive collection phase** (6 questions to user) but it's tool-mediated, not a guided walkthrough

(Full content already displayed above)

### 5. Existing Patterns for Interactive/Guided Workflows

**There is NO dedicated skill for step-by-step guided processes, tutorials, or walkthroughs.** Here's what exists that comes closest:

| Skill | Interactive Pattern | Nature |
|-------|-------------------|--------|
| `project-setup-bootstrap` | Asks 3 conversational questions (resumo, fase, restri√ß√µes) then auto-configures | **Conversational collection** ‚Üí auto-execution |
| `project-structure-analyze` | Asks 5 questions about the project then maps skills | **Analysis** ‚Üí recommendations ‚Üí approval |
| `project-workspace-create` | Deep context collection, recommended with Plan mode | **Plan mode review** ‚Üí execution |
| `skill-template-create` | Collects 6 inputs from user then generates | **Orchestrated collection** ‚Üí generation |
| `agent-task-manage` | Tracks multi-step tasks with todo list | **Task tracking** (not guided flow) |

**Pattern observed**: Skills that need user input use a "collect then execute" pattern ‚Äî they ask questions upfront, then run automatically. There is **no progressive/step-by-step guided pattern** where the agent walks the user through a process interactively, explaining each step, waiting for confirmation, and adapting.

### 6. Instructions Sections Related to Task Management

From [agent-skills-core.instructions.md](.copilot-core/instructions/agent-skills-core.instructions.md) (also available as attached context):

**"Tarefas Complexas" section:**
- Use `manage_todo_list` when 4+ steps, multiple requests, multiple files, requires planning
- Workflow: Create list ‚Üí mark in-progress ‚Üí execute ‚Üí mark completed ‚Üí next

**"Agent vs Plan Mode" section:**
- **Agent mode**: Clear, direct tasks
- **Plan mode**: Complex tasks needing review (e.g. `project-workspace-create`)

**"Clarifica√ß√£o" section:**
- Ask when request is vague, multiple interpretations possible, critical info missing
- Don't ask when info is explicit, convention is documented, decision is trivial

**No section exists** for guided walkthroughs, tutorials, or step-by-step interactive teaching.

### 7. Relevant Lessons Learned

**File**: [.copilot-project/memory/lessons-learned.md](.copilot-project/memory/lessons-learned.md)

No lessons directly related to guided/interactive workflows. The closest relevant lessons are:
- **2026-02-15 (estrutura)**: Chat-memory introduced for session persistence ‚Äî shows the system has session continuity but no guided flow concept
- **2026-02-16 (regras)**: Skills should be ‚â§150 lines, max 7 workflow steps, imperative language ‚Äî establishes constraints for any new skill
- **2026-02-15 (arquitetura)**: Action-review + output-validate created for proactive quality ‚Äî shows validation chain pattern but not guidance

### 8. Project-Specific Skills

**File**: [.copilot-project/skills/](.copilot-project/skills/) contains only:
- `agent-git-guard/config.yml` ‚Äî git permissions (all blocked for this workspace)
- `README.md`

No project-specific skills related to guided workflows.

### 9. All Files Read

| File | Path |
|------|------|

### Key Finding

**There is a clear gap**: The system has no skill or pattern for **guided step-by-step interactive workflows** ‚Äî where the agent progressively walks the user through a process, explains each step, waits for the user to complete it, confirms, and adapts. The existing "collect then execute" pattern (used by `project-setup-bootstrap`, `skill-template-create`) is the closest, but it front-loads all questions and then executes autonomously rather than guiding the user through each step interactively.

What needs to happen:

1. **Create a new skill**: `agent-guide-stepbystep` ‚Äî defines the interactive guided workflow pattern where the agent presents a macro overview first, then guides the user through one step at a time, waiting for feedback before advancing.

2. **Update core instructions** (`agent-skills-core.instructions.md`): Add a section about "Passo a Passo Guiado" behavior.

4. **Update skill counts**: Both instructions files reference "12 agent" skills and "60 total" ‚Äî these become 13 and 61.

5. **Update `agent-skills-project.instructions.md`**: Same count updates.

I need to create the new skill file, add an entry to the catalog, and update both the core and project instructions with the new counts and always-known reference. But wait ‚Äî I should verify whether these instructions files are actually separate or if one symlinks to the other, since both seem to have the same counts.

Looking at the core instructions file, I can see the agent skill row shows 12 items and the total is 60 skills across 6 types. The project instructions has identical entries, so both files need updating. Now I'm thinking about what should trigger this new skill ‚Äî phrases like "passo a passo," "me guia," "como fazer," and "me ens" seem like the natural activation patterns.

The behavior should follow a structured approach: first show a high-level numbered overview of all steps, then walk through each step in detail with explanations, pausing for user confirmation between steps. I'm also realizing this skill is distinct from agent-task-manage ‚Äî that one handles when the agent executes tasks autonomously, while this guides the user through a process themselves, so they're complementary rather than competing.

I think the best approach is to implement this as both a behavioral pattern in the instructions and a full skill, mirroring how agent-task-manage is structured. That way the instructions capture the core behavior while the skill provides the detailed protocol.

No project-specific skills related to guided workflows.

**There is a clear gap**: The system has no skill or pattern for **guided step-by-step interactive workflows** ‚Äî where the agent progressively walks the user through a process, explains each step, waits for the user to complete it, confirms, and adapts. The existing "collect then execute" pattern (used by `project-setup-bootstrap`, `skill-template-create`) is the closest, but it front-loads all questions and then executes autonomously rather than guiding the user through each step interactively.

# Agent Guide Step-by-Step

Protocolo de guia interativo para processos multi-etapa dirigidos ao usu√°rio.

## Quando Usar

- Usu√°rio pede "passo a passo", "me guia", "como fazer X"
- Processo com m√∫ltiplas etapas que o **usu√°rio** vai executar
- Onboarding, tutorial, explica√ß√£o de workflow
- Usu√°rio quer entender um processo antes de executar

## Quando N√ÉO Usar

- Agente executando tarefas autonomamente ‚Üí `agent-task-manage`
- Pergunta direta com resposta curta
- Consulta de informa√ß√£o sem processo sequencial
- Tarefa que o agente resolve sozinho sem intera√ß√£o

## Workflow

### 1. Apresentar vis√£o macro

Mostrar overview completo do processo com 1-2 linhas por passo:

```

1. **{T√≠tulo do Passo 1}** ‚Äî {descri√ß√£o curta}
2. **{T√≠tulo do Passo 2}** ‚Äî {descri√ß√£o curta}
3. **{T√≠tulo do Passo 3}** ‚Äî {descri√ß√£o curta}
...

Vamos come√ßar pelo Passo 1?
```

Aguardar confirma√ß√£o do usu√°rio antes de detalhar.

### 2. Detalhar um passo por vez

Para cada passo, apresentar com indicador de progresso:

```
üìå **Passo {X}/{N} ‚Äî {T√≠tulo}**

{Explica√ß√£o detalhada}
{Exemplos, comandos, c√≥digo se aplic√°vel}
{Contexto e notas importantes}

---
‚úÖ Concluiu este passo? Alguma d√∫vida antes de avan√ßar?
```

### 3. Aguardar feedback

**NUNCA** avan√ßar para o pr√≥ximo passo sem resposta do usu√°rio.

| Resposta do usu√°rio | A√ß√£o |
|---------------------|------|
| Confirmou / "pronto" / "pr√≥ximo" | Apresentar pr√≥ximo passo |
| Tem d√∫vida | Resolver d√∫vida, depois perguntar novamente se pode avan√ßar |
| Reportou erro | Ajudar a resolver, depois perguntar se pode avan√ßar |
| Quer pular passo | Informar consequ√™ncias, pular se confirmado |
| Quer voltar a passo anterior | Re-apresentar o passo solicitado |

### 4. Adaptar ao contexto

- Se o usu√°rio demonstra experi√™ncia ‚Üí reduzir explica√ß√µes
- Se o usu√°rio tem dificuldade ‚Üí expandir com mais exemplos
- Se surgir impedimento ‚Üí ajudar a resolver antes de continuar

### 5. Finalizar

Ao completar o √∫ltimo passo:

```

Resumo do que foi feito:
1. ‚úÖ {Passo 1}
2. ‚úÖ {Passo 2}
3. ‚úÖ {Passo 3}
```

## Regras

| Regra | Descri√ß√£o |
|-------|-----------|
| Um passo por vez | Nunca mostrar mais de um passo detalhado por mensagem |
| Aguardar sempre | Nunca pular para o pr√≥ximo sem confirma√ß√£o do usu√°rio |
| Vis√£o macro primeiro | Sempre come√ßar com overview antes de detalhar |
| Progresso vis√≠vel | Sempre mostrar indicador `Passo X/N` |
| Adaptativo | Ajustar n√≠vel de detalhe ao feedback do usu√°rio |

## Intera√ß√£o com Outras Skills

| Usu√°rio pede para o agente **executar** os passos | ‚Üí `agent-task-manage` |
| Processo envolve decis√µes de mem√≥ria/contexto | ‚Üí `agent-memory-register`, `project-context-update` |
| Guia envolve configura√ß√£o de projeto | Combinar com `project-setup-bootstrap` |
